intro: Alchornea philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine alchornea, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, typically greenish-yellow in color. It is often found in moist, lowland areas and is adapted to thrive in tropical climates. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecological systems.
